alert.note: Alert for Lower Garfield and Asotin Counties; Northeast Blue Mountains (Washington) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Pendleton (Northeast Oregon and Southeast Washington)
info.headline: Flood Watch issued June 12 at 3:34AM PDT until June 14 at 6:30PM PDT by NWS Pendleton
info.description: ...The Flood Watch continues for the following rivers in Washington...Oregon... Grande Ronde River at Troy affecting Lower Garfield and Asotin Counties, Wallowa County and Northeast Blue Mountains zones. .Moderate to heavy rain expected during the day Sunday will cause the river to rise through Monday. For the Grande Ronde River...including Troy...flooding is possible. Fld Observed Forecasts (5 am PDT) Location Stg Stg Day/Time Mon Tue Wed Grande Ronde River Troy 10.0 9.0 Sat 7 pm PDT 10.5 10.5 9.4 &&
info.instruction: If you are in the watch area, remain alert to possible flooding. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/pdt. ORZ050-WAZ031-032-122215- /O.CON.KPDT.FL.A.0004.220612T2100Z-220615T0130Z/ /TRYO3.0.ER.000000T0000Z.000000T0000Z.000000T0000Z.UU/ 334 AM PDT Sun Jun 12 2022 ...FLOOD WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM THIS AFTERNOON TO TUESDAY EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding is possible. * WHERE...Grande Ronde River at Troy. * WHEN...From this afternoon to Tuesday evening. * IMPACTS...At 10.0 feet, Minor flooding of fields adjacent to the river from Elgin through Troy and downstream to the confluence of the Snake River. River is forecast to peak at 10.8 feet during the day Monday before receding. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 3:00 AM PDT Sunday the stage was 9.4 feet. - Forecast...Flood stage may be reached late this afternoon. - Flood stage is 10.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood

area.areaDesc: Lower Garfield and Asotin Counties; Northeast Blue Mountains
